name: Pair Count
statement: You are given a prime number $$$p$$$, $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$, and an integer $$$k$$$. Find the number of pairs of indexes $$$(i, j)$$$ ($$$1 \le i < j \le n$$$) for which $$$(a_i \oplus a_j)(a_i^2 \oplus a_j^2) \equiv k \bmod p$$$. Here $$$\oplus$$$ denotes the bitwise XOR operation .
inputFormat: The first line contains integers $$$n, p, k$$$ ($$$2 \le n \le 3 \cdot 10^5$$$, $$$2 \le p \le 10^9$$$, $$$0 \le k \le p-1$$$). $$$p$$$ is guaranteed to be prime. The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$0 \le a_i \le p-1$$$). It is guaranteed that all elements are different.
outputFormat: Output a single integer â€” answer to the problem.
